title: conferred on me by sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the Health Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Infectious Diseases (EU Digital
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Infectious Diseases (EU Digital 

Covid Certificates) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 1st day of April 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited infectious disease (eu digital covid certificates) regulation 2022 (2) regulation shall come operation 1st day april 2022

title: conferred on me by sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the Health Act
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

issuance, verification and acceptance of 

“Digital Covid Certificate Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2021/953 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 20211 on a framework for 
the 
interoperable COVID-19 
vaccination, test and recovery certificates (EU Digital COVID Certificate) to 
facilitate free movement during the COVID-19 pandemic, as amended by 
Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/2288 of 21 December 20212 and 
Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/256 of 22 February 20223; 

“EU Digital Covid Certificate” has the meaning it has in the Digital Covid 
Certificate Regulation; 

“General Data Protection Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 20164 on the protection of 
natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free 
movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC; 

“personal data” has the meaning it has in Article 4 of the General Data Protection 
Regulation; 

“third country national” means a person who is – 

(a) not a national of a Member State, 

(b) 

(c) 

legally staying or residing in the State, and 

entitled to travel to Member States other than the State in 
accordance with the law of the European Union.

title: conferred on me by sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the Health Act
heading: 3. A person or body in the State that issues EU Digital Covid Certificates
text_raw:
3. A person or body in the State that issues EU Digital Covid Certificates 

in accordance with – 

1 OJ No. L 211, 15.6.2021, p. 1 
2 OJ No. L 458, 22.12.2021, p. 459 
3 OJ No. L 42, 23.2.2022, p. 4 
4 OJ No. L 119, 4.5.2016, p. 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st April, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [139] 3 

(a) 

(b) 

the Digital Covid Certificate Regulation, and 

the European Union (EU Digital Covid Certificates) Regulations 
2021 (S.I. No. 318 of 2021), 

may issue such a certificate to a third country national in accordance with that 
Regulation and those Regulations.
text_norm: 3 person body state issue eu digital covid certificate accordance - 1 oj no l 211 15.6.2021 p 1 2 oj no l 458 22.12.2021 p 459 3 oj no l 42 23.2.2022 p 4 4 oj no l 119 4.5.2016 p 1 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 1st april 2022 139 3 (a) (b) digital covid certificate regulation european union (eu digital covid certificates) regulation 2021 (s.i no 318 2021) may issue certificate third country national accordance regulation regulation

title: conferred on me by sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the Health Act
heading: 4. An obligation under the Digital Covid Certificate Regulation or the
text_raw:
4. An obligation under the Digital Covid Certificate Regulation or the 
European Union (EU Digital Covid Certificates) Regulations 2021 relating to 
the processing of personal data (including an obligation on a natural person, a 
legal person, a public authority, an agency or another body that has administered 
a Covid-19 vaccine, or carried out a test in respect of which an EU Digital Covid 
Certificate is to be issued) shall apply in respect of the personal data of a third 
country national. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 March, 2022. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [139]
text_norm: 4 obligation digital covid certificate regulation european union (eu digital covid certificates) regulation 2021 relating processing personal data (including obligation natural person legal person public authority agency another body administered covid-19 vaccine carried test respect eu digital covid certificate issued) shall apply respect personal data third country national given official seal 28 march 2022 stephen donnelly minister health 4 139

title: conferred on me by sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the Health Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations made under sections 5 and 31 (amended by section 34 of the 
Health Act 1953 (No. 26 of 1953)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) 
provide for the issuance of EU Digital Covid Certificates to Third Country 
Nationals. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [139] 5
